entries.meaning: A series of chirps, clicks or clucks.
examples: And here, if you like, the Cricket DID chime in! with a Chirrup, Chirrup, Chirrup of such magnitude, by way of chorus  [â€¦]

entries.meaning: (figurative, derogatory) A brief, high-pitched, insignificant statement.

verbs.description: chirrup (third-person singular simple present chirrups, present participle chirruping, simple past and past participle chirruped)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To make a series of chirps, clicks, or clucks.
examples: When other folks' squirrels are at home and asleep, yourn keep in motion among the trees and chirrup and sing, in a way that even a Delaware gal can understand their music!

entries.meaning: (transitive) To quicken or animate by chirping.
